question_text: Which of the following are true about modular power supplies? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: They allow for cleaner cable routing
They eliminate all risk of pinout mismatch
They can vary by brand in cable layout and voltage mapping
They offer flexibility in tight or custom builds
They require all cables to be connected before powering on
correct_answer: They allow for cleaner cable routing
They can vary by brand in cable layout and voltage mapping
They offer flexibility in tight or custom builds
explanation: Modular supplies improve layout and customization, but pinouts may vary across brands, and not all cables need to be plugged in unless required by the hardware.
